content:
The chunk defines a series of snake_case method aliases for the `Messenger` class, enabling developers to use more Pythonic naming conventions (e.g., `get_events` instead of `getEvents`). These aliases are placed at the end of the class definition to provide alternative, more readable method names while maintaining compatibility with existing camelCase method definitions. This section follows the main methods and their implementations, such as event handling, ignoring events, and verbosity toggling.

#snake_case alias:
    get_events = getEvents
    is_ignoring = isIgnoring
    who_accepts = whoAccepts
    find_all = findAll
    replace_method = replaceMethod
    ignore_all = ignoreAll
    is_accepting = isAccepting
    is_empty = isEmpty
    detailed_repr = detailedRepr
    get_all_accepting = getAllAccepting
    toggle_verbose = toggleVerbose
